# Data process


```{r global_assign, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'MHAS_w1','Mexican Health Aging Study.MHAS-2001',variables=list('a1_1'), missings = TRUE)
MHAS_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'MHAS_w1')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'MHAS_w2','Mexican Health Aging Study.MHAS_2003',variables=list('aa2_1'), missings = TRUE)
MHAS_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'MHAS_w2')
MHAS <- full_join(MHAS_w1,MHAS_w2, by="id")
MHAS_w2 <- left_join(MHAS_w2,MHAS_w1,by="id")

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'MHAS_w3','Mexican Health Aging Study.MHAS_2012_new',variables=list('aa2_1_12','a2a2_1_12','a2a1_12'), missings = TRUE)
MHAS_w3 <- opal.execute(o,'MHAS_w3')
MHAS_w3 <- left_join(MHAS_w3,MHAS,by="id")

```


We harmonise all waves together to make possible correct the data given in the first waves with the given later. The harmonisation algorithms of each wave are described in the corresponding paragraphs.

```{r global_harmo}

MHAS_w1$dbirth <- car::recode(MHAS_w1$a1_1, "NA=999; 99=998")

MHAS_w2$dbirth <- car::recode(MHAS_w2$a1_1, "NA=999; 99=998")
MHAS_w2$dbirth[which(MHAS_w2$dbirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- car::recode(MHAS_w2$aa2_1[which(MHAS_w2$dbirth %in% miss_values_vector)],"NA=999; 99=998")

MHAS_w3$dbirth <- car::recode(MHAS_w3$aa2_1_12, "NA=999; 99=998")
MHAS_w3$dbirth[which(MHAS_w3$dbirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- car::recode(MHAS_w3$a1_1[which(MHAS_w3$dbirth %in% miss_values_vector)],"NA=999; 99=998")
MHAS_w3$dbirth[which(MHAS_w3$dbirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- car::recode(MHAS_w3$aa2_1[which(MHAS_w3$dbirth %in% miss_values_vector)],"NA=999; 99=998")
MHAS_w3$dbirth[which((MHAS_w3$a2a1_12==2 & MHAS_w3$a2a2_1_12 %in% 1:31)  | (is.na(MHAS_w3$a1_1) & is.na(MHAS_w3$aa2_1) & is.na(MHAS_w3$aa2_1_12)))] <- car::recode(MHAS_w3$a2a2_1_12[which((MHAS_w3$a2a1_12==2 & MHAS_w3$a2a2_1_12 %in% 1:31)  | (is.na(MHAS_w3$a1_1) & is.na(MHAS_w3$aa2_1) & is.na(MHAS_w3$aa2_1_12)))],"NA=999; 99=998; 88=997")


```


## Mexico

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `a1_1` |`a2a1_12`|`a2a2_1_12`|
|----------|------|-|-----|
| **Label** | `Day of birth` |`Respondent's original stated birthday correct`|`Correct day of birth`|
| **Table name** | `MHAS-2001` |`MHAS_2012_new`|`MHAS_2012_new`|
| **Categories** |`continuous`|`1 = Yes`<br/>`2 = No`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** | `99 = Don't know` |`NA`|`88 = RF`<br/>`99 = DK`<br/>`NA`|
| **Description** |  |  |  |


```{r assign1, echo=F}

```

```{r local1, echo=F}
vari <- MHAS_w1$a1_1
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(99))[3], caption = "a1_1")
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(99))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(99))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(MHAS_w1, aes(a1_1)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Day of birth") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(0,33)


```

The other variables descriptions are shown in wave 3 section.


#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable `a1_1`. Further:

* `recode 99 "Don't know" into 998`
* `NA into 999`
* `if a2a1_12 == 2, into a2a2_1_12`

**R script:**

```{r harmo1}

MHAS_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=MHAS_w1$id)
auxw1 <- left_join(MHAS_w1[,c("id","dbirth")],MHAS_w3[,c("id","dbirth")],by="id", suffix = c("","_w3"))
auxw1$dbirth[which(!auxw1$dbirth_w3 %in% miss_values_vector & !is.na(auxw1$dbirth_w3))] <- auxw1$dbirth_w3[which(!auxw1$dbirth_w3 %in% miss_values_vector & !is.na(auxw1$dbirth_w3))]
MHAS_ds_w1$dbirth <- car::recode(auxw1$dbirth,"NA=999")
rm(auxw1)
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript1, echo=F}
vari <- MHAS_ds_w1$dbirth
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(MHAS_ds_w1, aes(dbirth)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Day of birth") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(1,31)
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation1, echo=F}
```

save(dbirth, file = "../RData/w1/dbirth.RData")

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable `aa2_1` merged with `a1_1`. Further:

* `recode 99 "Don't know" into 998`
* `NA into 999`
 * `if a2a1_12 == 2, into a2a2_1_12`


**R script:**

```{r harmo2}

MHAS_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=MHAS_w2$id)

auxw2 <- left_join(MHAS_w2[,c("id","dbirth")],MHAS_w3[,c("id","dbirth")],by="id", suffix = c("","_w3"))
auxw2$dbirth[which(!auxw2$dbirth_w3 %in% miss_values_vector & !is.na(auxw2$dbirth_w3))] <- auxw2$dbirth_w3[which(!auxw2$dbirth_w3 %in% miss_values_vector & !is.na(auxw2$dbirth_w3))]
MHAS_ds_w2$dbirth <- car::recode(auxw2$dbirth,"NA=999")
rm(auxw2)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable `aa2_1_12` merged with `a1_1` and `aa2_1`. Further:

* `recode 99 "Don't know" into 998`
* `NA into 999`
* `if a2a1_12 == 2, dbirth into a2a2_2_12`

**R script:**

```{r harmo3}

MHAS_ds_w3 <- tibble(id=MHAS_w3$id)
MHAS_ds_w3$dbirth <- MHAS_w3$dbirth

```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

```{r summ, echo=F}

MHAS.cw <- list(w1 = "w1", w2 = "w2", w3 = "w3")

# Consider only harmonised waves
l.hds <- lapply(MHAS.cw, function(wname) if(exists(paste0("MHAS_ds_",wname))){wname = get(paste0("MHAS_ds_",wname))})
nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}


m.hds <- list()

# Labelling of the tibbles and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

for(name in names(l.hds)) {
  aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
  label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label
  l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cont_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cont_label)
  m_name <- paste0("MHAS_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  m.hds[[name]] <- get(paste0("MHAS_m_ds_",name))
  rm(aux_object)
}

t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][2])[1:6]
t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[2]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][2])[1:6]
  t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[2]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
}
t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))

dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][2]))[[2]],names(l.hds))
kable(t.hds,caption=ds_label)



```
